rrr
  • Reference
  • Articles

Plot Residuals of Reduced-Rank Regression

rrr_residual_plot is a scatter plot matrix used for diagnostics of the reduced-rank regression model.

rrr_residual_plot(x, y, gamma_matrix, rank = "full", k = 0, plot = TRUE)

Arguments

x
data frame or matrix of predictor variables
y
data frame or matrix of response variables
gamma_matrix
weight matrix
rank
of the coefficient matrix to estimate. Default rank = full prodcues the standard multivariate regression technique.
k
small constant to add to the ridge of covariance matrices to avoid singularity.

Value

ggplot object, scatterplot matrix.

References

Izenman, A.J. (2008) Modern Multivariate Statistical Techniques. Springer.

Examples

data(tobacco)
tobacco_x <- tobacco[,4:9]
tobacco_y <- tobacco[,1:3]
gamma <- diag(1, dim(tobacco_y)[2])
rrr_residual_plot(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma)
#> Error in rrr_residual_plot(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma): (list) object cannot be coerced to type 'logical'
gamma2 <- solve(cov(tobacco_y))
rrr_residual_plot(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma2)
#> Error in rrr_residual_plot(tobacco_x, tobacco_y, gamma2): (list) object cannot be coerced to type 'logical'
